Field.name: chi
Field.summary: Community Health Index (CHI) number is a unique personal identifier allocated to each patient on first registration with a GP Practice. It follows the format DDMMYYRRGC where DDMMYY represents the persons date of birth, RR are random digits, G is another random digit but acts as a gender identifier, (where odd numbers indicate males and even numbers indicate females), and the final digit is an arithmetical check digit.

Biochemistry.summary: Tayside and Fife labs biochemistry data. This data is provided in a format based upon the SCI-Store system.

Field.name: ArithmeticComparator
Field.summary: This field represents additional information to be used in conjunction with the numeric result field Result. The contents should be interpreted along with the Result, for example, some EGFR results may be reported as Result = 60, with ArithmeticComparator = '>' This means the result is greater than 60.

Field.name: Interpretation
Field.summary: Contains comments regarding the result.

Field.name: Healthboard
Field.summary: This is the alpha and/or numeric Health Board code in which the patient CHI information was extracted from.

Field.name: SampleDate
Field.summary: This is the date and time when the sample was taken from the patient.

Field.name: SampleType
Field.summary: The type of sample that was run e.g. 'Blood', 'Serum' etc.

Field.name: TestCode
Field.summary: This field store the test code for the test taken/performed (e.g., CHOL = Cholesterol) as used by the providing organisation. This is the internal lab system identifier for the test being run (See ReadCodeValue for a coded answer). Includes non clinical/message codes such as ECOM.

Field.name: LabNumber
Field.summary: This is a unique identifier assigned by the lab system to identify a sample run. Each sample run can have multiple tests run.

Field.name: QuantityUnit
Field.summary: The unit of measure that the Result is expressed in e.g. "mmol/L" / "umol/L".

Field.name: ReadCodeValue
Field.summary: The read code allocated to the test. This field is useful as a standardised grouping for the tests, for example, if you are looking in Serum Total Cholesterol, all records marked with 44P. represent this regardless of the TestCode provided.

Field.name: RangeLowValue
Field.summary: Minimum guideline value for the test result at the time of testing. These ranges vary based on relevant criteria such as age, gender, and guidelines will also change over time.

Field.name: RangeHighValue
Field.summary: Maximum guideline value for the test result at the time of testing. These ranges vary based on relevant criteria such as age, gender, and guidelines will also change over time.

Demography.summary: Address and patient details as might appear in the CHI register

Field.name: Forename
Field.summary: Patients forename, randomly generated from a list of 100 common forenames that match the patients gender

Field.name: Surname
Field.summary: patients surname, randomly generated from a list of 100 common surnames

Field.name: ANOCHI
Field.summary: Annonymous identifier that has replaced the identifiable CHI. Typically represented as aaa1234567 where the first three letters uniquely identify a project (allowing for project specific anonymisation)

Field.name: DateOfBirth
Field.summary: Date of birth of the patient, this should match the first 6 digits of the CHI

Field.name: DateOfDeath
Field.summary: If the patient is dead then this date will be filled in with the date it occured

Field.name: Gender
Field.summary: M for Male patient, F for Female patient. Should match the second last digit of the CHI (if the patient has a CHI and not an ANOCHI) with odd numbers for females and even numbers for males.

Field.name: Address
Field.summary: The address which the patient lives at at the time of the EHR record being generated

Field.name: PreviousAddress
Field.summary: The previous address which the patient lived at when the EHR record being generated

Field.name: ResSeqNo
Field.summary: Unique number identifying a prescribable drug

Field.name: Quantity
Field.summary: The number prescribed to the patent e.g. 12

Field.name: Strength
Field.summary: The strength of the drug prescribed e.g. "2.5 MG"

Field.name: StrengthNumerical
Field.summary: The numerical portion of Strength e.g. 50 (must be combined with MeasureCode)

Field.name: FormulationCode
Field.summary: How the drug is provided e.g. "TABS", "CREAM"

Field.name: MeasureCode
Field.summary: The units portion of Strength e.g. MG

Field.name: Name
Field.summary: The common/proprietary name for the drug being prescribed e.g. VENTOLIN

Field.name: ApprovedName
Field.summary: The standardised name/active drug e.g. SALBUTAMOL

Field.name: BnfCode
Field.summary: Machine readable formatting of Bnf 0407010Q0AAAAAA

Field.name: FormattedBnfCode
Field.summary: Human readable formatting of Bnf e.g. 4.7.1

Field.name: BnfDescription
Field.summary: Lookup description of what the Bnf entry means
